definition: to serve as a sacrificial victim/to suffer for sb else/scapegoat/to share sb's fate
pad/cushion/mat/to pad out/to fill a gap/to pay for sb/to advance (money)
variant of 背[bei1]
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder

sentences.english: U. S. dollar had to stop for the winter.
sentences.chinese: 都知道美元在找过冬的垫背。

sentences.english: You cannot step on others shoulders, can only do others scapegoat.
sentences.chinese: 你不能踩着别人肩膀，就只能做他人垫背。

sentences.english: I just wanted to take one of ‘em down with me.
sentences.chinese: 我只是干掉他们其中一个为我垫背。

sentences.english: You can't step on others, can only do others scapegoat.
sentences.chinese: 你不能踩着别人肩膀，就只能做他人垫背。

definition: scapegoat/fall guy
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
lit. to pull sb into the water/to involve sb in a messy business/to get sb into trouble
devil/You devil! (as joke or insult)/the departed
to kill/to put to death
to be buried with or next to dead person (of deceased's partner, or of funerary objects)
to play tricks/to cheat/to get up to mischief/to become a ghost/to give up the ghost
hunting dog/hound/(fig.) running dog/lackey
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
shield/(fig.) excuse
to break even/to get one's money's worth
afraid to die (contemptuous term)
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
facing death/at death's door
coward/useless scoundrel
lit. to pull sb into the water/fig. to involve sb in a messy business/to get sb into trouble
